title: Robbie Malneek
text:
Robbie Malneek (born 3 April 1983) is a <a href="New%20Zealanders">New Zealand</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player.
Early career.
Malneek was born in <a href="Masterton">Masterton</a>, but moved with his family to <a href="Nelson%2C%20New%20Zealand">Nelson</a> aged eight. He attended secondary school first at <a href="Nayland%20College">Nayland College</a>, where he played <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Hooker">hooker</a>, and then, from 2000 to 2001, <a href="Nelson%20College">Nelson College</a>, where he moved to the back line and eventually <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Full-back">fullback</a>.
Senior career.
He made his provincial debut for <a href="Nelson%20Bays%20Rugby%20Union">Nelson Bays</a> in 2002, and has played for <a href="Tasman%20Rugby%20Union">Tasman</a> since that union was formed in 2006. He is currently the most capped player in Tasman's short history. He has also had two stints playing in Italy, first with <a href="Crociati%20Parma%20Rugby%20FC">Parma</a> in the 2007/08 and 2008/09 seasons, and then at <a href="Rugby%20Reggio">Reggio</a> in 2012/13.
Following the completion of <a href="2014%20ITM%20Cup">2014 ITM Cup</a> Malneek travelled to Sri Lanka to play for <a href="CR%20%26amp%3B%20FC">CR & FC</a> during the 2014/15 season. In the Spring of 2016, Malneek played with <a href="Mystic%20River%20Rugby%20Club">Mystic River Rugby Club</a> in <a href="Boston%2C%20Massachusetts">Boston, Massachusetts</a> in the American Rugby Premiership.
